title: American_Top_40_Top_37_of_the_70's_Incomplete
description:
This is the last three hours of a four hour show. I supplied the ten missing songs. If you don't want to play them, skip 

all the files that start with double zero.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a 

rebroadcast from internet radio.

Originally broadcast on January 5th, 1980, every song in this special is a former number one, including "Raindrops Keep 

Fallin' On My Head" (at number 31) by B.J. Thomas; the very first number one of the decade.

Of the 50 songs in this survey, 20 of the songs are by groups, 14 are by male solo singers, 10 by female solo singers, and 

6 by duos, only one of which is a married couple. Eighteen songs are by forien acts, and there are no instrumentals. Only 

one song is a remake and 7 are from the movies.

Elton John comes in as the top male solo star of the seventies.

Donna Summer earns the title of biggest disco artist of the decade.

The Carpenters rank as the number one American act of the seventies and the Bee Gees are the biggest over-all act of the 

decade.



50: Family Affair - Sly & The Family Stone
49: Kiss You All Over - Exile
48: Fifty Ways To Leave Your Lover - Paul Simon
47: The Way We Were - Barbra Streisand
46: I Think I Love You - Partridge Family
45: Me & Mrs. Jones - Billy Paul
44: Don't Go Breaking My Heart - Elton John & Kiki Dee
43: Three Times A Lady - Commodores
42: December 1963 - Four Seasons
41: I Honestly Love You - Olivia Newton-John
40: I Just Want To Be Your Everything - Andy Gibb
39: Let It Be - Beatles
38: American Woman - Guess Who
